repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13377,18 +13377,20 @@ M.funcs = {
     args = 1,
     base = 1,
     desc = [=[
-      The result is a Number, which is the width of window {nr}.
-      {nr} can be the window number or the |window-ID|.
-      When {nr} is zero, the width of the current window is
-      returned.  When window {nr} doesn't exist, -1 is returned.
-      An existing window always has a width of zero or more.
+      Gets the width of |window-ID| {nr} (zero for "current
+      window"), or -1 if window {nr} doesn't exist. An existing
+      window always has a width of zero or more.
+

@@ -13377,18 +13377,20 @@ M.funcs = {
     args = 1,
     base = 1,
     desc = [=[
-      The result is a Number, which is the width of window {nr}.
-      {nr} can be the window number or the |window-ID|.
-      When {nr} is zero, the width of the current window is
-      returned.  When window {nr} doesn't exist, -1 is returned.
-      An existing window always has a width of zero or more.
+      Gets the width of |window-ID| {nr} (zero for "current
+      window"), or -1 if window {nr} doesn't exist. An existing
+      window always has a width of zero or more.
+
       Examples: >vim
         echo "The current window has " .. winwidth(0) .. " columns."
         if winwidth(0) <= 50
           50 wincmd |
         endif
-      <For getting the terminal or screen size, see the 'columns'
-      option.
+      <
+      To get the visible "viewport", use |getwininfo()|: >vim
+          :echo getwininfo()[0].width - getwininfo()[0].textoff

@@ -13377,18 +13377,20 @@ M.funcs = {

+
       Examples: >vim

         if winwidth(0) <= 50
           50 wincmd |
         endif
-      <For getting the terminal or screen size, see the 'columns'
-      option.
+      <
+      To get the visible "viewport", use |getwininfo()|: >vim
+          :echo getwininfo()[0].width - getwininfo()[0].textoff

comment_data.body: I assume you mean `winheight()`. I'll update that too.

comment_data.body: oh yikes. i'll drop this change for now.

comment_regular_data.body:
Backport failed for `release-0.11`, because it was unable to cherry-pick the commit(s).

Please cherry-pick the changes locally and resolve any conflicts.
```bash
git fetch origin release-0.11
git worktree add -d .worktree/backport-33223-to-release-0.11 origin/release-0.11
cd .worktree/backport-33223-to-release-0.11
git switch --create backport-33223-to-release-0.11
git cherry-pick -x 57d99a515f57454370b6c122545ea53685d22d1b
```
